dialogue.text: But what if none of us really know what we are?
Years later, Maya's daughter asks the question at dinner. The family laughs, recognizing another soul beginning the eternal dance.
You've just discovered the family question.
Your mom taught me it was okay not to know myself. That was the greatest gift anyone ever gave me.
Your grandfather was so afraid. Until he learned fear was just the question wearing a scary mask.

visual_elements.evan_presence: Journals on shelves, plaque in garden

psychological_notes: Third generation encounters the question with different context - cultural acceptance, family support, normalized uncertainty. Yet personal encounter remains powerful. Shows successful multi-generational transmission of healthy relationship with existential questions. Pattern continues but evolves.
philosophical_underpinning: Each generation must personally engage eternal questions despite inherited wisdom
therapeutic_direction: Breaking cycles of existential trauma through conscious transmission
